workflow.name: Interactive recruitment customer service with WhatsApp, Google Sheets CRM & notifications
workflow.description:
# ğŸ‘” Recruitment Office WhatsApp Automation

Automate WhatsApp communication for recruitment agencies with an interactive, structured customer experience. This workflow handles pricing inquiries, request submissions, tracking, complaints, and human escalation while maintaining full session tracking and media support.

## Good to know

- Uses WhatsApp Interactive List Messages for user selection and navigation.
- Includes session-state logic and memory across messages.
- Includes a 5-minute cooldown to avoid spam and repeated triggers.
- Supports logging for all interaction types including media files.
- Includes both a global bot shutdown switch and per-user override.

## How it works

- A customer sends a message to the official WhatsApp number.
- The workflow replies with an interactive menu containing 8 service options:
  - ğŸ’° Pricing by nationality (8 supported countries)
  - ğŸ“ New recruitment request submission
  - ğŸ” Tracking existing applications via Google Sheets lookup
  - ğŸ” Worker transfer link distribution
  - ğŸŒ Translation service information
  - ğŸ“„ Required documents and instructions
  - âš ï¸ Complaint submission and routing
  - ğŸ‘¤ Request a human agent
- The workflow retrieves or stores data based on the selection using Google Sheets and Data Tables.
- If the customer requests human help or the logic detects uncertainty, the workflow:
  - Pauses automation for that user
  - Notifies a designated staff member
- All interactions are logged including files, text, timestamps, and selections.

## Features

- ğŸ“‹ Structured WhatsApp service menu
- ğŸ“„ CRM-style recruitment request logging
- âœ¨ Pricing logic with nationality mapping
- ğŸ” Lookup-based status tracking
- ğŸ“ Support for media uploads (PDF, images, audio, documents)
- ğŸ§  Session tracking with persistent user state
- ğŸ¤ Human escalation workflow with internal notifications
- ğŸ›‘ Anti-spam and cooldown control
- ğŸš Bot master switch (global + per-user)

## Technology stack

| Component | Usage |
|----------|-------|
| n8n | Automation engine |
| WhatsApp Business API | Messaging and interactive UX |
| Google Sheets | CRM and logs |
| Data Tables | State management |
| JavaScript | Custom logic and routing |

## Requirements

- WhatsApp Business API account with active credentials
- n8n Cloud or self-hosted instance
- Google Sheets for CRM storage
- Data Tables enabled for persistent session tracking

## How to use

- The workflow uses a Webhook trigger compatible with common WhatsApp API providers.
- Modify menu content, pricing, optional steps, and escalation flows as needed.
- Link your Google Sheets and replace test sheet IDs with production values.
- Configure human escalation to notify team members or departments.

## Customising this workflow

- Replace Google Sheets with Airtable, HubSpot, or SQL storage.
- Add expiration and reminder messages for missing documents.
- Add AI-powered response logic for common questions.
- Enable multi-country support (Saudi/UAE/Jordan/Qatar/Kuwait/etc.)
- Connect to dashboards for reporting and staff performance analytics.

parameters.content:
## WhatsApp Webhook Entry Points

Three webhook endpoints receive messages from WhatsApp Business API:
- Main webhook
- Backup webhook 2
- Backup webhook 3

Handles:
âœ“ Text messages
âœ“ Interactive button/list replies
âœ“ Images, videos, audio, voice notes
âœ“ Documents (PDF, Excel, etc.)
âœ“ Webhook verification (hub.challenge)

Routes to data extraction

parameters.content:
## Message Data Extraction

Parses incoming WhatsApp webhooks and extracts:
- Phone numbers (sender & business)
- Contact names
- Message content (text/media)
- Interactive replies (button/list selections)
- Media metadata (type, ID, mime, caption, filename)

Structures data for downstream processing
Handles all WhatsApp message types uniformly

## Media File Management

Process:
1. Detect media presence (image/video/audio/document)
2. Fetch media URL from WhatsApp API
3. Download file as binary
4. Convert to base64
5. Store in Data Table with metadata

Supports:
ğŸ–¼ï¸ Images â€¢ ğŸ¥ Videos â€¢ ğŸµ Audio
ğŸ¤ Voice notes â€¢ ğŸ“„ Documents

Keeps original filenames and mime types

## Bot Enable Check & Session Tracking

Label Tracker:
- Tracks which menu section user is in
- Maintains context across messages
- Identifies main menu vs sub-menu interactions

Bot Master Switch:
- Global on/off control
- Per-user override capability
- Prevents bot from responding when disabled

Session State:
- Tracks conversation flow state
- Records last interaction timestamp
- Manages user journey through menu system

## Conversation History Logger

Logs every message (incoming & outgoing):
- Stores in global workflow memory
- Tracks: text, timestamp, direction, type
- Maintains last 5000 messages
- Links messages to contacts
- Preserves media metadata (no heavy files)

Used for:
â†’ Conversation review
â†’ Analytics
â†’ Customer history
â†’ Debugging

## Main Menu Display

Cooldown System (5 minutes):
- Prevents menu spam
- Tracks last menu send time per user
- Only shows menu if cooldown passed

Interactive Menu Options:
ğŸ’² Prices
ğŸ“ New Request  
ğŸ” Track Request
ğŸ”„ Worker Transfer
ğŸŒ Translation
ğŸ› ï¸ Complaints
ğŸ¢ About Office
ğŸ¤ Talk to Agent

Prepares â†’ Logs â†’ Sends via WhatsApp API

## Smart Menu Navigation

Menu Route (Main Options):
Routes to 8 primary services based on button ID

Sub Route (Nested Actions):
- price_* â†’ Price lookup flow
- req_* â†’ New request flow  
- complaint_* â†’ Complaint handling
- m_* â†’ Back to main menu

Each route:
1. Prepares appropriate response
2. Logs outgoing message
3. Sends via WhatsApp API
4. Triggers backend actions (Google Sheets, Email)

## Complete Service Flows & Backend Integration

ğŸ“Š PRICE INQUIRY
- Static data (8 nationalities with prices in SAR)
- User selects nationality â†’ Bot sends price
- No backend needed

ğŸ“ NEW REQUEST
1. User selects nationality
2. Bot sends CV link
3. Save to "Ø·Ù„Ø¨Ø§Øª Ø¬Ø¯ÙŠØ¯Ø©" sheet
4. Email staff (fahadrecr@gmail.com)
5. Send confirmation to customer
Data: Phone, Name, Nationality, Status: "Ù‚ÙŠØ¯ Ø§Ù„Ù…Ø±Ø§Ø¬Ø¹Ø©"

ğŸ” REQUEST TRACKING
1. Bot asks user to wait
2. Lookup phone in Google Sheets
3. Found â†’ Send status
4. Not found â†’ Send error message

ğŸ”„ WORKER TRANSFER
1. Send transfer page link
2. Save to "Ù†Ù‚Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø§Ø¯Ù…Ø§Øª" sheet
3. Email staff notification
4. Confirm to customer

ğŸŒ TRANSLATION SERVICE
- Send WhatsApp link for phone interpretation
- All nationalities supported
- Static response only

ğŸ› ï¸ COMPLAINTS
Types: Worker issue, Service issue, Delays, Financial, Other
1. User selects complaint type
2. Save to "Ø´ÙƒØ§ÙˆÙŠ" sheet
3. Email staff immediately
4. Confirm receipt to customer

ğŸ¢ ABOUT OFFICE
- Licensed info, 8 nationalities, prices
- 2-year insurance, contact info
- Static text response

ğŸ¤ HUMAN AGENT
1. Send "please wait" message
2. Email staff immediately
3. Include customer name & phone

ğŸ“Š GOOGLE SHEETS CRM (3 Tabs)
- "Ø·Ù„Ø¨Ø§Øª Ø¬Ø¯ÙŠØ¯Ø©" - New requests
- "Ù†Ù‚Ù„ Ø§Ù„Ø®Ø§Ø¯Ù…Ø§Øª" - Transfers
- "Ø´ÙƒØ§ÙˆÙŠ" - Complaints
Operation: Upsert by phone number

âœ‰ï¸ EMAIL NOTIFICATIONS
To: fahadrecr@gmail.com
Triggers: New request, Transfer, Complaint, Human agent
Includes: Customer details, request type, timestamp

All flows: Prepare â†’ Log â†’ Send â†’ Backend Action

# âš ï¸ Important Note

# This workflow is part of a larger system.
# It is not a standalone workflow â€” it connects to a full dashboard where:

## - All data from the workflow is saved
## - All incoming and outgoing messages are displayed
## - A human escalation process is available when the automated workflow cannot complete the task or requires manual intervention

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
